pageContext.claim: “It's hurting Denmark very badly [allegedly owning Greenland] because they're losing almost $700 million a year carrying it. So they carry it at a great loss.”
pageContext.analysis: Denmark subsidized Greenland at a cost of nearly $550 million in 2017, and also covered some administrative costs. But Denmark is also one of Greenland's largest trading partners and benefits from its imports, and it could just as easily be said that Denmark is paying to maintain an asset whose value is difficult to calculate.
